name: Neptune

moons.origin: Formed in the outer solar nebula; includes captured objects (e.g., Triton)

current_interest: Triton as a captured Kuiper belt object with possible geologic activity

fun_facts: Neptune has the strongest sustained winds in the Solar System.
Triton orbits Neptune retrograde and may be a captured Kuiper belt object.
Voyager 2 remains the only spacecraft to visit Neptune up close.
description_short: The distant ice giant with extreme winds and a dynamic atmosphere.
description_long: Neptune is the eighth planet from the Sun and an ice giant composed mainly of hydrogen, helium, and volatile ices. It exhibits powerful winds, dynamic storms, and a system of moons including Triton, which likely originated in the Kuiper belt. Voyager 2's 1989 flyby provided the bulk of our close-up knowledge; Neptune remains a high-priority target for future missions to study ice giant formation, atmospheric physics, and satellite oceans.
